element.name: Cosmic Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

element.name: Ancestral Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

element.name: Primordial Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

element.name: Sacred Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

element.name: Supernatural Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

element.name: Mythical Lore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

element.name: Aberrant Ground
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to make the ground around you in a 10ft radius dough-like difficult terrain for up to 1 minute. The effect is centered on you and travels with you, ending early if you are unconscious or choose to dismiss it (no action required).
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Adhesive Appendage
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As an action, you can launch your pseudopod towards a creature of your choice within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged lore attack, on a hit the target is grappled. The grapple lasts for 1 minute, or until the target or another creature within reach uses their action to break free.
You can use this lore a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining uses after a long rest.

element.name: All-Around Vision
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Be it by additional eyes, eye-stalks, or a preternatural sense, you are able to see in all directions at once. You double your proficiency bonus when making Wisdom(Perception) checks, and you cannot be surprised while your are not incapacitated.

element.name: King of the Puddings
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast takes on ooze-like qualities that put other oozes at ease. Ooze type monsters are indifferent to you provided you don't disturb them, and you can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. If provoked to an aggressive state they will treat you with hostility as normal.

element.name: Limited Telepathy
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30ft of you.
A telepathic bond between you is formed, allowing you to speak telepathically with each other provided you both speak a language the other knows.
You can maintain a bond up to a number of miles equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 mile), and the bond ends after a number of minutes equal to your blue mage level.
The bond ends early if you are incapacitated, slain, or if you form a new bond.

setters.set: Cast: 30ft and Maintain: Int modifier miles

element.name: Mind-Breaking Touch
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As an action you make a melee lore attack against a creature adjacent to you. On a hit, the creature takes bestial psychic damage, as a momentary exposure to your inner beast leaves them shaken. Until the end of their next turn, they have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short, or long rest.

element.name: Ooze Climb
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: By studying the movement of the ooze, you have learned to adopt their secret climbing methods. You gain a climbing speed equal to your move speed, and an climb on any surface, across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings without needing to make any ability checks.

element.name: Pseudopod Appendage
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You grow a pseudopod which you can use as a natural weapon using Intelligence for attacks and damage, and on a hit you deal bestial psychic damage.

element.name: Sensorium
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to perceive through the senses of a willing creature you have a telepathic bond with. For the duration you see and hear what it does, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. While perceiving through the creature's senses you gain the benefit of any special senses possessed by that creature, though you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings. You can only perceive through one creatures senses at a time, though you can use your action to switch between willing creatures.

element.name: Slime Breath
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to expel a spray of gelatinous ooze in a 30-foot cone before pulling it back in. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet straight toward you, to an unoccupied space.
You can use this lore a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

element.name: Sticky Secretions
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You body secretes an adhesive solution in your sweat that gives you advantage on attack rolls and ability checks made to start or maintain a grapple.

element.name: Vomit Ooze
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to expend a bestial die and vomit an Ooze Spawn into an empty space adjacent to you. The ooze spawn is an ally to you and your companions and can maintain its form for up to 1 hour or until dismissed, after which it dissolves into a harmless puddle of muck. In combat, the spawn shares your initiative count, but takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you), but cannot speak. If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger. Once the ooze spawn is disolved you regain your bestial die.

element.name: Alien Mind
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your mind is altered to such a degree, others can be harmed just by connecting to it. As a reaction, when a creature tries to read your thoughts or deal psychic damage to you, they must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or become Stunned until the end of your next turn. The stunned creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short, or long rest.

element.name: Caustic Expulsion
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your slime breath is accompanied by a caustic stomach acid which burns those it touches. A creature that is pulled by your slime breath suffers 8d8 acid damage, or half on a failed save as it washes out over the area before dissolving.

element.name: Eat Memories
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to prey on the vulnerable mind of an adjacent incapacitated creature. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or you can select a 1hr period from the past 24 hours in its mind. The selected hour of memories are lost from the creature and gained by you. Without prior knowledge you cannot know the contents of a given hour period before you steal it. The creature's memory can be restored with a lesser restoration spell or similar magic.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Enslave
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Employing aggressive psionics you can use your action to impose your will on a creature you can see in 30ft. The target makes a wisdom saving throw or becomes charmed by you for 1 hour. For the duration, the creature obeys your commands as best it can, cannot use reactions, and has a telepathic bond with you. The enslavement ends early if you are slain, fall unconscious, or the creature moves beyond the range of your bond. The creature can repeat its saving throw whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Exert Will
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to force a creature you have charmed to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature moves up to it's speed as you mentally direct, and makes a melee attack against a target you designate. The creature cannot be compelled to move into an obviously deadly hazard, such as a fire or pit, but will provoke opportunity attacks to move to the desired location. Once it has made the attack, the charm ends.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Psionic Rally
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to focus and release a psionic pulse that targets all allies within 30 feet of you that aren't obscured by cover. Each creature effected is shocked to their senses and can end any charmed or frightened conditions affecting them.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Psychewall
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You are at one with the psionic power of your inner beast, and together your defenses are formidable. You become immune to any magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can only telepathically communicate with you if you allow it.

element.name: Psychic Backlash
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you are critically hit or reduced to 0 hit points you unleash a burst of psychic energy that shares your pain to those nearby. All creatures in 10ft of you take psychic damage equal to half your blue mage level + your Intelligence modifier.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Telepathic Hub
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You are able to create a number of simultaneous telepathic bonds equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 connection) and share telepathic messages between all members of the hub. In addition your bonds no longer expire provided the member remains within range. You or the member can choose to sever a bond (no action required).

element.name: Protective Thrall
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, and a creature you have charmed is within 5 feet of both you and the attacker, you can have the charmed creature take the damage instead. The charmed creature can then repeat its saving throw against the charm, ending it on a success.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Azure Minora
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your study of lore has revealed two new cantrips to you. When you learn this lore, select 2 cantrips from the wizard spell list, whenever you memorize this lore those cantrips become available to you. Your spellcasting ability for these cantrips is Intelligence.

element.name: Gaze of the Warden
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Using a reflective surface such as a mirror or the surface of a still pool of water, you can cast a clairvoyance spell without using a spell slot or material components.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Harrowing Glare
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to release a flash of unearthly light from your eyes. Creatures that can see you in a 15ft cone centered on your position must make a Wisdom saving throw, becoming incapacitated until the start of their next turn on a failed save.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Heart Sight
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you touch a creature, you magically know its current emotional state. If the creature fails a Charisma saving throw, you can also learn the creature's alignment. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail this saving throw.

element.name: Illumination
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can use a bonus action to increase the radius of its brightness by 10ft up to a maximum of 30 feet, to decrease it by 10ft, or to suppress the light entirely.

element.name: Inscrutable
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You have advantage on saves against effects that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts, as well as any divination. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain your intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

element.name: Iron Scent
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can pinpoint, by scent, the location of ferrous metal within 30 feet of you.

element.name: Labyrinthine Recall
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can perfectly recall any path you have traveled, and your always know which way is north. You cannot get lost unless magically deceived.

element.name: Merfolks Blessing
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast takes on an aquatic affinity. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and can breathe both air and water.

element.name: Oil Spray
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to release a spray of oil in a 5-foot wide, 20-foot long line covering each tile in the line's path. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw or become soaked in oil for up to 1 minute when the oil dries. While soaked this way any exposure to a source of flame causes the target to take an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil.

Each tile covered in oil can be lit, causing the square to set flame for 2 rounds, dealing 5 fire damage to each creature that enters the area or ends it turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. The fire spreads to any adjacent oil covered squares at the end of each round.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Oxidizing Touch
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You corrode metal with a touch. If not being worn or carried, you can spend 10 minutes to destroy a 1-foot cube of nonmagical ferrous metal. The process is too slow to make use of in combat, however doing so extracts nutrients from the corroded metal and you can sustain yourself for a day with 2lbs of corrodible metal.

Wearing non-metallic gloves will block the effect of your touch and allow you to wield or touch metal without corroding it, however wearing metal armor will cause it to gradually erode, inflicting a -1 penalty to the AC it provides every 10 minutes. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

element.name: Psychometry
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: If you spend at least 10 minutes interacting with an object you gain magical insights into its history. The DM tells you one of the following characteristics of your choice:

tr.td: • The item's name, if it has one
• A vision of the last creature to handle the item
• An impression of the emotional state the last creature was in when the item was used
• If the item is a weapon, or has been used as a weapon, an image of the last creature injured or killed by it
• A vision of the item's owner or creator
• Lore regarding the item's historical significance, if any

description.p: You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Repulsive Breath
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to exhale a nauseating stench in a 15ft cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to steel themselves, or become Frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature that starts its turn in 15 feet of you must use all its movement to get as far from you as possible, finishing the movement before taking an action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, it can repeat its saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Serpent Hair
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your hair is replaced with a mass of writhing snakes that are part of you, shifting and mirroring your emotions. You can also use your action to have them make a melee lore attack against an adjacent foe, dealing 1d4 piercing and 1d4 poison damage on a hit.

element.name: Shape-Shift
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to polymorph into an inanimate object or back into your true form. Your statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying are not transformed, and you revert to your true form if you are slain. You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Summon Mannequin
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can spend 10 minutes magically producing a mannequin composed of hardened slime that retains its form for up to 1 hour.
The doll can take the appearance of a medium sized humanoid creature you can see, one you are familiar with, or you can produce a generic appearance.
The doll includes clothing and accessories of any color, though none of the parts are functional or come apart from the doll.
It looks particularly life-like, but does not hold up to close physical inspection as touch reveals it is all one squishy piece.
While the doll does not animate, a creature can use an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your Lore save DC to identify it is not real from a distance.
After the duration has passed, the doll dissolves into a puddle of harmless muck.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Temporal Flux
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You create a small, localized distortion in the flow of time that shuffles the order of events during combat. Each creature in 30 feet of you re-rolls its initiative.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Vanity Mirror
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to surround yourself with illusory magic that causes creatures who look upon you to see a member of their own race and sex with roughly the same build as your normal appearance. This illusion lasts for up to 1 hour, or until you dismiss it (no action required), and does not stand up to close inspection. If someone attempts to touch you they will pass through the illusion learning you are disguised. Otherwise a creature can use an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your Lore save DC to discern that you are disguised.

element.name: Web of Hair
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to rapidly grow your hair, filling a 30-foot cube of space adjacent to you before detaching. This web of hair is difficult terrain, its area is lightly obscured, and persists for 1 minute. A creature that moves into the web or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw or become Restrained while in the web. A creature can use a Strength check against your Lore save DC, freeing itself or a creature within 5 feet of it on a success. The webbing is immune to all damage except magical fire. a 5-foot cube of the web is destroyed it if takes at least 20 fire damage from a spell or other magical source on a single turn.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Azure Majora
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You draw upon the power of the inner beast and convert it into raw arcane potential. When you learn this lore, select one spell of 3rd Level or lower from the wizard spell list. Your spellcasting ability for this spell is Intelligence. While this lore is memorized you can cast the selected spell without using a spell slot or material components (components with a gold cost must be supplied).
You can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Command Hair
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to magically grow and weave your hair into a 50ft length of rope which detaches from you with AC12 and 10 hit points. The rope remains under your control within 30 feet of you for up to 1 hour, after which it falls apart into worthless strands of hair.

You can use a bonus action to move the rope up to 20ft to a Large or smaller creature you can see, who must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become grappled by the rope (the escape DC is equal to your Lore save DC). The target is released if you die, if you become incapacitated, or by using another bonus action.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Consume Magic
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to target a creature you can see concentrating on a spell in 60 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or lose concentration. If you break the creature's concentration this way you gain 5 temporary hit points for each level of the spell that was ended, to a minimum of 5.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Dimensional Rift
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action, you can create an invisible and immobile rift within an opening or frame within 5 feet of you, provided the space is no bigger than 10 feet on any side. The rift bridges the distance between that space and any point within 30 feet of it you can see or specify by distance and direction (such as "30 feet straight up").

While next to the rift, you can see through it and are considered to be next to the destination as well, and anything you put through the rift (including a portion of your body) emerges at the destination. Only you can use the rift, and it lasts until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Displacement
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As an action you project an illusion that makes you appear to be standing near your actual location. For 1 minute attack rolls against you to have disadvantage. The effect is disrupted until the start of your next turn if an attack hits you, your speed is reduced to 0, or you are incapacitated.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Dream Eater
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction, when a creature wakes from being unconscious, you can feed on the momentary miasma of dreams still in their mind. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or take 3d10 psychic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the amount of damage taken.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Fey Charm
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to target a humanoid or beast you can see in 30 feet. If the target can see you, it must make a Wisdom save or be magically charmed. The creature regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way possible.

Each time you or your allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise the effect lasts 1 hour, or until you are slain, on a different plane of existence from the target, or end the effect as bonus action. If the target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to your fey charm for 24 hours.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Implosion
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As an action you manifest a powerful distortion in the fabric of space at a point you can see within 120ft. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes bestial force damage, is knocked prone, and is moved to an unoccupied space closest to the sphere's center. On a success a target only takes half damage and isn't knocked prone or moved. Large and smaller objects that aren't being worn or carried in the sphere automatically take the damage and are similarly moved.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Insatiable Greed
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to sense the presence of gold, silver, electrum, or platinum in 30 feet of you. If you sense a source this way you can determine which location has the greatest amount, its direction, and the direction of its movement (if any). You cannot locate the source if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between you and it.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Lilliputian Lyric
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to target a creature or object that is neither worn or carried within 30 feet of you, and call upon mischievous fey magic. The target is affected as if you had cast a reduce spell upon it, without using a spell slot or material components.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Malevolent Obsession
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to present an inanimate object of 5lbs or less to a creature you can see within 30 feet, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed for up to 1 minute, or until you or your allies do anything to harm them.

While charmed this way the creature becomes obsessed with attaining the presented object and will attack anyone who gets between them and their possession of it. The charm ends if they retain possession of the item for a whole turn or if they succeed on a Wisdom saving throw repeated at the end of each turn.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Pocket Dimension
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You possess access to a demiplanar pocket roughly 64 cubic feet in size, which can hold up to 500lbs, resembling the interior of a bag or backpack inside. You can stow or obtain inanimate objects that aren't being worn or carried as an action by touching them, the object vanishing from sight or appearing in your hand (or an empty adjacent square if it is too large to hold) as appropriate.
If the pocket is overloaded, it is ruptured and destroyed as its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. Only after 24 hours will the pocket mend and restores itself, ready for use once more.
If you are slain, or this lore is no longer memorized, all the contents of the pocket dimension spill out manifesting around you unharmed in the nearest open space.

element.name: Pond Chorus
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to call upon mischievous fey energies and target a creature within 60 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be transformed into a frog as if affected by a polymorph spell cast without spending a spell slot or using material components for up to 1 hour. You must concentrate on the effect for the duration.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Spell Vitalization
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when a spell of 1st level or higher is cast within 30 feet, you can siphon some of the magic to enhance yourself. You can move up to twice your speed without provoking attacks of opportunity, then make a melee weapon attack.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Time Slip
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to create a debilitating distortion of time around a creature. Select a creature you can see within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is temporarily subjected to old age for up to 1 minute.

For the duration their speed is reduced by 10 feet, they must roll a d4 and subtract the result from each Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw or ability check, and they can neither charm others or be charmed. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on themselves on a success.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Pixie Dust
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can release a small puff of pixie dust towards a creature adjacent to you. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or fall asleep for 1 minute. The creature is unconscious for the duration, however it wakes if it takes any damage or if another creature uses its action to shake the sleeper awake.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Adaptive Camouflage
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can temporarily alter the appearance of your body to match the environment around you. As a bonus action, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks for 10 minutes. You can end the effect early as a bonus action.
You can use this lore a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

element.name: Athletic Endurance
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you travel long distance your inner beast works in unison with those around you to go further. You and your allies have advantage on Constitution saving throws against exhaustion from pushing a forced march, and cover an additional mile per hour when you do.

element.name: Boon of the Postmaster
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You have an uncanny intuition for wayfinding in civilized settings. This intuition grants you advantage on ability checks made to navigate, find a specific address, or locate specific individuals in an urban environment.

element.name: Celerity
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: While not wearing armor or using a shield, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

element.name: Deadly Maul
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action, you can jump up to a number of feet equal to half your movement, without provoking opportunity attacks. If your jump ends within 5 feet of another creature, you can make an attack against the target. On a hit the target is also knocked prone if they are no more than one size larger than you.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Fledgling Wings
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast has unlocked the secret of flight. You gain a fly speed equal to your walking speed, you can decide on the appearance of your wings and when/how they manifest, though you can only fly in short bursts; you fall if you end your turn in the air and nothing else is holding you aloft. To use this speed, you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

element.name: Hedge Wisdom
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You are granted insight into nature, bestowing upon you the following benefits:

tr.td: • You become proficient with the Herbalism Kit
• You become proficient in the Nature or Medicine skill, if you are already proficient in nature you may select another
• You have advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks to identify a plant, flower, or other type of flora

element.name: Keen Senses
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast's primal senses hone and magnify your qualia, allowing you to make Wisdom (Perception) checks with advantage.

element.name: Mighty Charge
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to charge up to your speed straight towards a target and make an attack. On a hit, you deal 3 additional bestial bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a Strength save or be pushed back 10 feet and knocked prone.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Natural Projectiles
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You sprout 12 sharp needles, spines or another organic projectile of your choice. This counts as a ranged natural weapon you are considered proficient with, and has a range of 30/90. It uses your Intelligence modifier for attacks and damage, dealing bestial bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage (chosen when you memorize this lore).

element.name: Natures Gift
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you memorize this lore you grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. You are considered proficient with the weapon and it uses your Intelligence modifier for attacks and damage, dealing bestial bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage (chosen when you memorize this lore).

element.name: Pack Formation
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast reveals ancient tactical knowledge granting you the stance of the Pack. You can use your bonus action to enter the stance until the end of your next turn. For the duration while you are within 5 feet of two or more allies, each of you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Piercing Roar
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to unleash an ear piercing roar audible up to 100 feet. Each creature in 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw or flinch, unable to move until the end of their next turn.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Savage
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you make a weapon attack on your turn, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you roll initiative.

setters.set: 5 feet near original target + within weapon range

element.name: Self Sacrifice
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when an ally within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can swap places with them and take the attack in their stead.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Thermal Vision
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action you can magically sense creatures purely by the heat they give off. Until the start of your next turn you can see creatures within 60 feet of you that aren't behind cover. This form of vision ignores invisibility and stealth.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Tunneler
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast grants you the knowledge of the burrower. You gain a burrowing speed equal to half your walking speed, which can be used to burrow through soft earth and dirt but not stone or harder materials. When you use it, you leave a 5ft wide tunnel in your wake.

element.name: Web Sling
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As an action, you can shoot webbing at a target within 60 feet of you, forcing a creature to make a Dexterity saving throw and become restrained for 1 minute on a failed save. The target or a creature within reach of it may use their action to make a Strength check against your Lore save DC, breaking the webbing on a success. The webbing is flammable, and if exposed to fire it burns away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 fire damage to the restrained creature.
You can use this lore twice, regaining expended uses on a long rest.

element.name: Wing Attack
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your wings to maneuver yourself from deadly situations. With a strong flap of them, creatures in 10 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you. You can then move up to half your fly speed.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Inspiring Command: Forward
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to compel an ally in 30 feet of you to act. The target can use their reaction to move up to their speed towards an enemy.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Inspiring Command: Hold
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to aid an ally in 30 feet of you. The target gains advantage to saving throws against effects that would move them, or knock them prone.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Inspiring Command: Rally
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to compel an ally in 30 feet of you to act. The target can use their reaction to repeat one saving throw against an ongoing condition they are suffering.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Bastion Formation
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast reveals ancient tactical knowledge granting you the stance of the Bastion. As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on attacks of opportunity, and foes have disadvantage on melee attacks against you until the end of your next turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Bestial Unity
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: On your turn, while mounted, your inner beast can command (no action required by you) your mount's beast to lash out. Your mount may use its reaction and make one attack against a target within 5 feet of you, this attack benefits from the effect of Bestial Might.
Additionally you have advantage on checks made to remain mounted.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Blinding Spores
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to emit noxious spores. Each creature in a 15 foot radius of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become Poisoned and Blinded for up to 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each turn.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short, or long rest.

element.name: Booming Roar
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to unleash a thunderous roar audible up to 500 feet. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw or take 3d8 thunder damage, and become Deafened for up to 1 minute. A deafened creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each turn ending the effect on a success.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Dreadful Resilience
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when you take an amount of damage equal or greater than half your maximum hit points and survive, you can threaten your enemies. Foes who see and hear you in 30 foot must make a Wisdom saving throw or become Frightened of you for up to 1 minute, repeating the saving throw at the end of each turn.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Engulf
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can call on nature to ensnare a foe. As an action while you have a medium or smaller creature grappled, you envelop it with vines, plants and overgrowth for up to 1 minute or until the grapple is broken. The creature becomes blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the end of their turn or suffer bestial bludgeoning damage until the grapple ends. If you move, the engulfed creature moves with you. You can only have one creature engulfed at a time.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Fearless Resolve
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when you see an ally reduced to 0 hit points you can move up to your speed towards them, restoring them to 1 hit point with a rapid medical aid if you reach them. Each attack of opportunity you trigger during this movement grants your ally an additional 1d4 hit points if you reach them, as the struggle fuels your resolve.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Green Blooded
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast has unlocked the secrets of regeneration. You can re-attach severed limbs immediately by holding it to the stump, or re-grow a lost limb over the course of a short or long rest. Additionally, when you spend Hit Dice during a short rest you restore an additional number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

element.name: Heavy Spines
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your projectiles grow larger and fewer. You grow half as many, but each deals two bestial die of damage on a hit instead of one.

element.name: Inspiring Command: Attack
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to compel an ally in 30 feet of you to act. The target can use their reaction to make a melee attack against an adjacent foe.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Inspiring Command: Defend
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to compel an ally in 30 feet of you to act. The target can use their reaction to take the dodge or hide action.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Inspiring Command: Retreat
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to compel an ally in 30 feet of you to act. The target can use their reaction to disengage and move up to their speed away from an enemy.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Invoke Rage
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to release a potent burst of targeted pheromones. Creatures of your choice in a 10-foot radius can use their reaction to make a melee weapon attack. If the attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they can move up to half their speed and make another melee attack.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Juvenile Wings
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your wings are growing stronger each day and you are becoming more proficient with using them. You no longer fall to the ground if you end your turn in the air, and your fly speed increases by 15 feet.

element.name: Mature Wings
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You have become fully accustomed to your wings and they have grown to full strength. Your flying speed increases by 15 feet, you can carry another creature while flying at half speed, and you can fly while wearing medium armor.

element.name: Relentless Stalker
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: If you have met a creature or have access to an item they have come into contact with in the last month, you may use your action to obtain their scent.

When you do so, you gain the benefits of a locate creature spell for 1 hour without concentration. A creature being tracked this way can't surprise you or become hidden from you, and if invisible gains no benefit from the condition against you.
You can use this feature twice, regaining expended uses when you finish a long rest.

element.name: Venomous Beast
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can infuse a piercing natural weapon with an injury poison using your bonus action, which lasts for up to 1 minute. On a successful hit you deal an additional 3d8 poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become Poisoned until the end of their next turn.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Web Flurry
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you use your action to web sling, you can select two targets within 30 feet of one another and shoot webbing at each of them. Additionally, you can use web sling up to three times per day, instead of twice.

element.name: Wounded Fury
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: While you have less than half your total hit points, you deal an extra one die of bestial damage when you hit with a melee weapon attack, in addition to the normal damage for that weapon. While you have less than 10 hit points remaining, you deal two extra bestial dice damage instead.

element.name: Breath Weapon (Lesser)
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to unleash an elemental breath weapon. When you learn this lore you can select either a line or cone shaped weapon, and a damage type from the following: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Your choices become fixed. A lesser breath weapon produces a 15ft cone or 15-foot long, 15-foot wide line. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 damage of the chosen element type on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

You may learn this lore multiple times or replace an existing breath weapon lore, each time you learn it you may select a different combination of shape and damage types, and you cannot memorize more than one breath weapon at a time.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short, or long rest.

element.name: Chromatic Lens
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action when you use a lore that inflicts Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison damage, you can change the energy to any of the other types listed here. The damage type can be changed after rolls are made but before the results are announced.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Dracolore
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You are granted the ancient lore of the draconic scribes, blessing you with the following features:

tr.td: • You can speak, read, and write the Draconic language
• You become proficient in the History skill, if you are already proficient in history you may select another
• You have advantage on Intelligence (History) checks to identify individual dragons, and their territorial claims.

element.name: Energy Absorption
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when you are hit by a source of Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison, you instead take no damage and restore a number of hit points equal to the damage amount. You can only use this lore after you have been hit, but before the damage is rolled.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Flaming Leap
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action you jump through the air to an unoccupied square within 30 feet. When you land, each creature in 10 feet of the destination must make a Dexterity saving throw or take bestial fire damage.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Frigid Shield
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can manifest a shield of ice as a reaction when you see a creature make an attack against you. The shield grants you 10 temporary hit points for up to 1 minute. If your temporary hit points are reduced to 0 as the result of taking damage, each creature in 5 feet of you takes bestial Cold damage.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Heart of the Dragon
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction, when you start your turn suffering from the frightened or paralyzed conditions, you can repeat your saving throw. On a success, you set a striking example to allies in 30 feet who gain advantage on saving throws until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Hide of the Ancients
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your body is covered in draconic scales, granting you 1AC.

element.name: Ice Skate
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action you can leave a trail of rime and frost where you step. Until the end of your current turn, each square you move into becomes icy difficult terrain for up to 1 minute. The ice can also be melted prematurely by any source of magical flame.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Lightning Backlash
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when you take damage from a melee weapon attack, you can unleash a burst of lightning at the attacker. They must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or suffer bestial lightning damage.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Mud Breath
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to spit a large globule of hot sticky mud at one creature you can see in 60 feet that is Large sized or smaller. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw or become restrained for 1 minute, repeating the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, and freeing itself on a success.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Olach Morrah
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: By meditating for 10 minutes, you are able to become one with the earth, Petrifying yourself. While petrified in this way you are restrained, and can only perceive via tremorsense up to 60 feet around you. You can restore yourself at any time as an action.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Primal Erudition
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast grants you ancient knowledge of the elementals. You gain the following features:

tr.td: • You can speak, read, and write the Primordial language
• You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to discern the behavior of Elementals
• You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to navigate and wayfind in both natural environments and storms

element.name: Secrets of the Hordekeeper
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast gains a preternatural instinct for identifying value and worth in objects. You can spend 1 minute studying a gem or art piece, after which you learn its exact value; and if it is a gemstone, you also learn what kind of gemstone it is.
Additionally, you can cast the detect magic and identify spells as rituals that do not require material components.

element.name: Snowshoe
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can move across or climb icy surfaces without making ability checks, and neither ice or snow cost extra movement for you to move across.

element.name: Sonic Scream
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to conjure thunderous energy in a 15ft cube, starting in any square adjacent to you. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take bestial Thunder damage and be knocked prone.
Once you use this lore you can't use it again until youfinish a short or long rest.

element.name: Breath Weapon (Greater)
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast is growing accustomed to channeling elemental energies. You can select one breath weapon from your journal and upgrade it to a greater breath weapon, dealing an additional 5d6 damage of its type, and increasing its area by 15ft (30ft cone, or 30ft long, 5ft wide line).

element.name: Cinder Blast
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As an action you exhale a blast of hot cinders in a 15ft cone, each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or become blinded until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this ability you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Earth Tide
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to reach into dirt or stone underfoot and rip it up, unleashing a tidal wave of debris in a 10-foot wide, 30-foot long line. Each square in the waves path becomes difficult terrain, and each creature in its path must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 4d8 damage, and becomes buried beneath rubble.

While buried, a creature is restrained and cannot stand, the only action it can take on its turn is to make a Strength check against your lore DC to escape. An adjacent unburied creature can attempt to pull them free as an action making a similar check.
Once you use this ability you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Acid Body
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits you corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If the penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits you is destroyed after dealing damage.

element.name: Cold Body
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You produce an aura of cold in a radius of 5 feet around you. At the start of your turn, all nonmagical flames in the aura are extinguished, and any creature that starts its turn in the area takes 1d4 cold damage.

element.name: Fire Body
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you hit with a melee attack, if the target is a creature or a flammable object that isn't being worn or attended, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

element.name: Lightning Body
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you are targeted by or included in the area of an attack that deals lightning damage, the energy is amplified by your elemental body dealing an additional 1d4 lightning damage to all targets besides yourself.

element.name: Thunder Body
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You produce an aura of turbulent winds up to 10 feet around you. A creature that tries to move closer to you must spend 2 feet of movement for each foot of distance it moves towards you, and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made in the area.

element.name: Generate Charge
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to start building an electrical charge in your body that continues to grow for the next minute. While active, you can use your bonus action on each turn to discharge the lightning at a target, and if the target is a creature you can make a ranged lore attack, dealing bestial lightning damage on a hit. If you fail to discharge the lightning this way by the end of each turn for the duration, you take the lightning damage instead.
This lore requires you to concentrate on it as if it were a spell and ends early if concentration is disrupted.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: One With the Elements
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast has learned to attune itself to an element. When you select this lore, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison. Your choice becomes fixed, and when you memorize this lore you gain resistance to the selected damage type. You can only memorize one instance of this lore at a time.

element.name: Pyretic
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You infuse a creature with debilitating heat. Select a creature you can see within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature is cursed with elemental heat, and takes bestial fire damage whenever they take an action. They can repeat their saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on themselves on a success.
Once you use this ability you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Self Destruct
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast rapidly converts your living essence into an explosive burst of flame. You sacrifice all of your remaining hit points, and creatures in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on you must succeed at a dexterity saving throw or take 1d10 fire damage per 10 hit points sacrificed, or half as much damage on a successful save.
Once you use this ability you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Stormstride
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action while you are within the area of a storm (of any element), you and your equipment vanish, reappearing in any unoccupied square within the radius of the storm.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Wind Javelin
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to channels the elemental power of thunder to conjure a javelin-like form of wind and rain. You hurl the javelin at a point you can see within 600 feet of you. Each creature in 20 feet of the point must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d10 thunder damage and become deafened for 1 minute, repeating the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themselves on a success.
Once you use this ability you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Channel the Storm
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Within the area of a storm, you can use your action to draw on its elemental power. Select a point within the storm's area up to 120ft from you, each creature in a 20ft radius of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 10d6 damage of the storm's elemental type on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Once you use this ability you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Terrifying Presence
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You project an aura of daunting strength and ancient cunning. Creatures within 10 feet of you suffer a penalty to saving throws against being frightened equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum -1) as long as you are conscious.

element.name: Voltaic Fog
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You manifest and concentrate on a 20-foot-radius sphere of electrically charged fog centered on a point you can see within 120 feet. The fog spreads around corners, and lasts for up to 10 minutes, until you lose concentration, or until a strong wind disperses the fog. Its area is heavily obscured.

A creature entering the fog's area for the first time on a turn or starting its turn there, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer 6d8 lightning damage, or only half as much on a successful save.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

element.name: Discern Honesty
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to channel divine wisdom. For 10 minutes you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine if a creature believes what it is saying.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Divine Will
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when a creature you can see makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check you can cause the roll to be made with advantage or disadvantage.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Enlightenment
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You are gifted divine knowledge granting you the following benefits:

tr.td: • You can speak, read, and write the Celestial language
• You become proficient in the Religion skill, if you are already proficient in religion you may select another
• You have advantage on Intelligence (Religion) checks to identify a religion by its insignia or customs

element.name: Glorious Light
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: When you create a magical source of light it becomes empowered with celestial might, overpowering magical darkness of any level.

element.name: Guiding Winds
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a reaction when an ally in 30 feet of you makes a ranged weapon attack, you can supply guiding winds that help ensure their shot meets its mark, granting them advantage on the attack roll.

element.name: Phalanx Formation
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your beast is blessed with the tactical knowledge of the celestials granting you the stance of the Phalanx. You can use your bonus action to enter the stance until the end of your next turn. For the duration while you are within 5 feet of an ally wielding a shield you both gain advantage on Dexterity based attacks and saving throws.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Return to Nyx
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to make a corpse you can see within 30ft to burst into a shower of radiant stars leaving no trace behind. Everything it is wearing or carrying remains. Each creature within 10ft of the corpse when it bursts must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take bestial radiant damage.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Spiritual Sustenance
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast can rely on the power of the divine to help sustain it, reducing your hunger. Your rations sustain you for twice as long as usual.

element.name: Bite of the Kindred
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your teeth grow into sharpened deadly fangs. You can use your fangs as a natural weapon to make a melee attack against an adjacent foe, dealing 1d6 piercing damage on a hit. You deal an additional 1d4 necrotic damage when you hit with your bite attack under the light of the full moon.

element.name: Bloodthirst
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your fangs to drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is grappled by you, incapacitated, or restrained. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit you deal 1 piercing damage plus bestial necrotic damage, the target's maximum hit points are reduced by the amount of necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the same amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Bottom Treader
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You cannot swim, instead you sink to the bottom of water bodies. However, you stuffer no penalties to movement or attacks while underwater, and you are immune to the effects of being underwater while at a depth greater than 100 feet.

element.name: Cloak of Shadows
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your bonus action to emit dim light in a 10 foot radius. Non-magical light can't illuminate this area, and it lasts until you diminish it using your action.

element.name: Ghost Sight
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane and vice-versa.

element.name: Hellish Weapons
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: As a bonus action on your turn you can deal poison damage instead of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing with your next melee weapon attack.

element.name: Maddening Feast
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to spend 1 round feasting on the corpse of a creature that died in the last minute. Each of its allies in 60 feet that can see and hear your feast must make a Wisdom saving throw or become Frightened for 1 minute, repeating their save at the end of each turn. The feast is interrupted if you are damaged or moved, however if you spend a round feasting without interruption you regain 1 bestial die of hit points.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

element.name: Pale Blessing
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Undead that you create are bolstered by your inner beast's necromantic attunement. When you create undead their hit point maximum is increased by an amount equal to your blue mage level, they add your proficiency bonus to weapon damage rolls, and they have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

element.name: Pest Shapes
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast can tap into the forms of other pests, granting you additional options when taking on a vermin form. You can now become a bat, fly, spider, or snake instead.

element.name: Raxivorts Tongue
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can communicate with bats, rats, giant bats, and giant rats. The knowledge and awareness of many such beasts are limited by their intelligence, but at a minimum can give you information about nearby locations, monsters, and whatever they have perceived in the past day. You might be able to persuade them to perform a small favor for you at the DM's discretion.

element.name: Shadow Blend
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: While in dim light or darkness you can use a bonus action to sink into the shadows for up to 10 minutes, granting you advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made for the duration. This advantage ends early if you are exposed to light.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

element.name: Shadow Dance
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use a bonus action to step into a square of dim light or darkness, and teleport to another square of dim light or darkness within 30 feet of your original position.
You can use this lore a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence modifier.

element.name: Soul Weapon
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast can shape and manifest your essence into a weapon to wield against your enemies. You can use your action to create a soul weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it (see the Weapons section for weapon options). You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

Your soul weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

You can transform one magic weapon into your soul weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extra-dimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your soul weapon thereafter.

You can’t affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your soul weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extra-dimensional space when the bond breaks.

element.name: Swarm Shapes
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: Your inner beast can spread your essence over a multitude of smaller forms when you use vermin form. You can now become a swarm of bats, rats, insects, or spiders instead.

element.name: Vermin Form
element.source: The Blue Mage: True Blue Update

description.p: You can use your action to transform yourself into a rat for up to 1 hour, until you drop to 0 hit points, or until you revert as an action. While transformed your equipment merges as part of your rat form and you cannot activate, use or otherwise benefit from your equipment. You use the physical ability scores of the rat, but retain your mental scores, memories, alignment, and personality.

When you revert to normal, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed, and if you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points any excess damage is carried over to your normal form. As long as the excess doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked unconscious.
Once you use this lore, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
